items.title: How to carry spaghetti on the Inca Trail: Inside Intrepid’s efforts to reduce single-use plastics
items.excerpt: For 11 months of the year, about 160,000 people – including travellers, tour guides, cooks and porters – hike the ancient roads and trails that traverse the Andes and lead to Machu Picchu, the Inca Empire’s sacred city. As the third largest operator on the trail, Intrepid is w…

items.title: Back to nature: On a mission to protect Australia’s Daintree Rainforest forever
items.excerpt: The Intrepid Foundation’s newest partner in Australia, Rainforest Rescue, is working with Traditional Owners to protect and restore threatened parts of the Daintree Rainforest.

items.title: How a hot tip from a local shaped this new Urban Adventure in Bangkok
items.excerpt: Intrepid Urban Adventures product manager Doru Raduta says a new Bangkok day tour proves it’s possible to find respite from the city’s sensory overload.

items.title: How can travel help after a natural disaster?
items.excerpt: After a hurricane, earthquake or wildfire, travel can feel like the last thing that matters. But for communities on the frontlines of disaster, in places like Nepal, Morocco and North Carolina, it’s often an important piece in their recovery. A traveller on the first Intrepid …

items.title: How kids are helping EcoThailand protect the planet
items.excerpt: Thailand’s most popular tourism destinations are facing more environmental challenges than ever before – but local communities are stepping up, with support from EcoThailand.
